name: Aatrox
title: the Darkin Blade
lore: Once honored defenders of Shurima against the Void, Aatrox and his brethren would eventually become an even greater threat to Runeterra, and were defeated only by cunning mortal sorcery. But after centuries of imprisonment, Aatrox was the first to find freedom once more, corrupting and transforming those foolish enough to try and wield the magical weapon that contained his essence. Now, with stolen flesh, he walks Runeterra in a brutal approximation of his previous form, seeking an apocalyptic and long overdue vengeance.
blurb: Once honored defenders of Shurima against the Void, Aatrox and his brethren would eventually become an even greater threat to Runeterra, and were defeated only by cunning mortal sorcery. But after centuries of imprisonment, Aatrox was the first to find...
allytips: Use Umbral Dash while casting The Darkin Blade to increase your chances of hitting the enemy.
Crowd Control abilities like Infernal Chains or your allies' immobilizing effects will help you set up The Darkin Blade.
Cast World Ender when you are sure you can force a fight.
enemytips: Aatrox's attacks are very telegraphed, so use the time to dodge the hit zones.
Aatrox's Infernal Chains are easier to exit when running towards the sides or at Aatrox.
Keep your distance when Aatrox uses his Ultimate to prevent him from reviving.

riot_spells.name: The Darkin Blade
riot_spells.description: Aatrox slams his greatsword down, dealing physical damage. He can swing three times, each with a different area of effect.
riot_spells.tooltip:
Aatrox slams his greatsword down, dealing {{ qdamage }} physical damage. The Darkin Blade may be re-cast 2 additional times, each one increasing in damage.

Each strike can hit with the Edge, briefly knocking enemies up and dealing more damage.

riot_spells.name: Infernal Chains
riot_spells.description: Aatrox smashes the ground, dealing damage to the first enemy hit. Champions and large monsters have to leave the impact area quickly or they will be dragged to the center and take the damage again.
riot_spells.tooltip:
Aatrox smashes the ground, dealing {{ wdamage }} physical damage to the first enemy hit and slowing by {{ wslowpercentage*-100 }}% for {{ wslowduration }}s.

Champions or Large Monsters have {{ wslowduration }}s to leave the impact area or be dragged back and damaged again.

riot_spells.name: Umbral Dash
riot_spells.description: Passively, Aatrox heals when damaging enemy champions. On activation, he dashes in a direction.
riot_spells.tooltip:
Passive: Aatrox heals for {{ espellvamp }}% of damage he deals to champions.

Active: Aatrox dashes in a direction.

riot_spells.name: World Ender
riot_spells.description: Aatrox unleashes his demonic form, fearing nearby enemy minions and gaining attack damage, increased healing, and movement speed. If he gets a takedown, this effect is extended.
riot_spells.tooltip:
Aatrox reveals his true demonic form for {{ rduration }} seconds. On activation, he fears nearby enemy minions and gains Movement Speed, decaying over the duration. While World Ender persists, he gains {{ rtotaladamp*100 }}% Attack Damage and increases self healing by {{ rhealingamp*100 }}%.

On enemy champion takedown, World Ender is extended.

riot_passive.name: Deathbringer Stance
riot_passive.description: Aatrox deals bonus damage on his next attack, healing for the damage dealt.

i1.name: Deathbringer Stance
i1.description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Aatrox''' periodically empowers his next basic attack to gain {{sti|range|50 '''bonus''' range}} and deal {{as|{{pp|key=%|5 to 12}} of the target's '''maximum''' health}} as {{tip|physical damage|{{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}}}} [[on-hit]], capped at 100 against monsters, and {{tip|heal|healing}} him for 100% of the {{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}} dealt, reduced to 25% against {{tip|minions}}.
i1.description2: ''Deathbringer Stance's'' {{sti|cooldown}} is reduced by 2 seconds whenever '''Aatrox''' hits a champion or large monster with a basic attack or an ability, doubled if he hits with the edge of {{ai|The Darkin Blade|Aatrox}}. The cooldown reduction for {{ai|The Darkin Blade|Aatrox}} applies only once and prioritizes for the unit hit by the edge.
i1.notes:
* '''Aatrox''' will assume stance when an enemy champion is in range of {{ai|Infernal Chains|Aatrox}}.
* The empowered attack is given [[on-attack]]. Commanding an attack before ''Deathbringer Stance'' is avaiable, but hitting the target while it's available will not trigger the bonus damage.

q1._preamble:
<!--Edit these paramater values when they get changed
-->{{#vardefine:b1|10}}<!--First Swing Base Rank 1 Damage
-->{{#vardefine:b2|90}}<!--First Swing Base Rank 5 Damage
-->{{#vardefine:r1|60}}<!--First Swing Ratio Rank 1 Damage
-->{{#vardefine:r2|80}}<!--First Swing Ratio Rank 5 Damage
-->{{{{{1<noinclude>|Ability data</noinclude>}}}|The Darkin Blade|{{{2|}}}|{{{3|}}}|{{{4|}}}|{{{5|}}}
q1.description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Aatrox''' swings his greatsword in the target direction, striking enemies in a line. ''The Darkin Blade'' can then be reactivated twice within 4 seconds, with each cast refreshing the timer. The second cast strikes enemies in a cone and the third in the target area. There's a 1 second cooldown between each cast.
q1.description2: Each strike deals {{as|physical damage}}, reduced to 40% against {{tip|minions}}. All units take 25% increased damage on the second cast and 50% on the third.
q1.leveling2: {{st|First Swing Damage|{{ap|{{#var:b1}} to {{#var:b2}}}} {{as|(+ {{ap|{{#var:r1}} to {{#var:r2}}}}% AD)}}|Second Swing Damage|{{ap|{{#var:b1}}*1.25 to {{#var:b2}}*1.25}} {{as|(+ {{ap|{{#var:r1}}*1.25 to {{#var:r2}}*1.25}}% AD)}}|Third Swing Damage|{{ap|{{#var:b1}}*1.5 to {{#var:b2}}*1.5}} {{as|(+ {{ap|{{#var:r1}}*1.5 to {{#var:r2}}*1.5}}% AD)}}}}
q1.description3: Hitting enemies at the far end of the first two casts and the center of the third deals 50% '''bonus''' damage and {{tip|airborne|knocks up}} enemies for {{fd|0.25}} seconds, doubled to {{fd|0.5}} seconds against {{tip|monsters}}.
q1.target_range: {{tt|650|First cast}} / {{tt|525|Second cast}} / {{tt|200|Third cast center}} / {{tt|120|Empowered range offset}}
q1.notes:
* Each cast of the ''The Darkin Blade'' has a small channel time, during which '''Aatrox''' cannot move and cast abilities, except for {{ai|Umbral Dash|Aatrox}} and {{si|Flash}}.
* All damage modifiers stack multiplicatively.

w1.name: Infernal Chains
w1.description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Aatrox''' smashes the ground in the target direction, creating a chain that stops on the first enemy hit, dealing {{as|physical damage}}, doubled against {{tip|minions}}, and {{tip|slow|slowing}} them by 25% for {{fd|1.5}} seconds.
w1.leveling: {{st|Physical Damage|{{ap|30 to 70}} {{as|(+ 40% AD)}}|Minion Damage|{{ap|30*2 to 70*2}} {{as|(+ 80% AD)}}}}
w1.description2: If ''Infernal Chains'' hits a {{tip|champion}} or large monster, they are chained to the impact area. If the chained enemy is still in the impact area after {{fd|1.5}} seconds, they are {{tip|airborne|dragged}} to the center and take the same damage again.

e1.name: Umbral Dash
e1.description: {{sbc|Passive:}} '''Aatrox''' {{tip|heals}} for a percentage of the non-periodic {{tt|damage|Post-mitigation}} he deals against champions.
e1.description3: ''Umbral Dash'' resets '''Aatrox's''' basic attack timer and can be cast during his other spell casts without interruption.

r1.name: World Ender
r1.blurb: Aatrox unleashes his demonic form, gaining attack damage and movement speed.
r1.description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Aatrox''' unleashes his true demonic form for 10 seconds, {{tip|fear|fearing}} nearby enemy {{tip|minions}} for 3 seconds, and gaining {{sti|{{as|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}}, decaying over the duration.
r1.description2: While transformed '''Aatrox''' gains increased size and {{as|'''bonus''' attack damage}}, and receives increased {{tip|heal|self-healing}} from all sources ({{sti|spell vamp}} exception).
r1.description3: With each enemy champion takedown, ''World Ender'' is extended by 5 seconds, refreshing its effects, up to the original amount.
r1.notes: * His resource bar indicates the remaining duration of ''World Ender''.
